column4: My ubuntu install is sticking at 5%, any ideas on how to fix it?
Yes, I'm installing 10.04.
what do you mean "sticking"?
troubleshoot.  did you checksum the iso and the burned install disk?
I did a checksum on the iso, but how do I checksum a burned disk? Make an image and get the checksum of that?
no checksumming the burned iso is a little different.  see the tutorial i sent your way
btw, if BOTH check out, i'd suggest downloading and using the alternate installation iso just to avoid the gnome hiccups
I need to burn a new cd, it looks like. I just took out the cd and glanced at the bottom, then realized that I had found the thing on my desk under some papers and stuff. Covered in scratches!
well i guess that MIGHT effect things...:)
Well, yeah. If the disk can't be read, it's unlikely to install properly.
I swear, I just looked at the bottom of that scratched disk and saw "MICROSOFT". I immediately threw it away and remembered that my computer originally ran windows.
still?  did you try the alternate install distro?
I've gotten 10.04 installed on the same computer before, but I'm installing to a USB disk now.
installing to usb or creating a usb startup disk - NOT the same
I've got to go for a couple minutes, back soon.
Back
I'm installing to a USB harddrive, not creating a USB boot disk.
restate the issue for the board.  Personally, I think just creating a start up disk is a whole lot easier than the USB install.  but that's me :)
How  would I set up a USB boot disk?
System>Administration>Startup Disk Creator
On livecd?
yes
